name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Seattle Bremerton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Want a reasonable place to stay with just a ferry ride away from Seattle? Great location and don't have to pay the high price for parking in Seattle! Breakfast is included! Cereal, waffles, fruit and juice! Pretty basic but good!
reviews.title: Great location to jump on the ferry to Seattle!

reviews.text: Staff are very friendly. Rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable.
reviews.title: Fairfield Inn and Suites Bremerton

reviews.text: Walking duistance to Starbucks, restaurants and movie theatre.
reviews.title: Excellent value in Bremerton
Had a great stay
reviews.text: Very good hotel in downtown Bremerton. Free WiFi, breakfast, and greatest asset is impeccable cleanliness. New, clean, with friendly staff. Laundry with 2 washers and 2 dryers on 2nd and 4th floor. Very handy.

reviews.title: Good location
reviews.text: Traveling on business for the Navy, it is right next to the Shipyard and Naval Base.

Location, staff, hotel nice except for one small problem. We were on 3rd floor and the window opened all the way, no screen, no safety measures in place for a small child to easily fall out the window or an adult to jump. We were very surprised at this issue. Surprised for a Marriott property.
reviews.title: Don't Jump

reviews.text: The location is very convenient to Puget Sound Naval Shipyard and the ferry to Seattle. Rooms are nice for a Fairfield Inn. The bed was very comfortable. Views from the hotel facing the water are fantastic. The complementary breakfast is nothing to write home about, but it is convenient and fast.
reviews.title: Great Location in Bremerton
Great location and customer service!
reviews.text: I recently stayed with colleagues at the Fairfield Inn and Suites Bremerton WA based upon reviews from Trip Advisor and suggestions from local residents. The atmosphere of the hotel is first class all the way and front desk staff member-Danielle was very professional and provided a welcoming and assistive environment from check in to check out. We will definitely stay again upon our next visit to the area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic! Very clean and new! The hotel is two blocks from the Ferry Terminal in Bremerton, a one hour ferry ride from downtown Seattle. The ferry ride is a pleasure! Breakfast wasn't great, but complete and included in the room rate.
reviews.title: A great pace to stay in the Seattle area!

reviews.text: We are a family of 5 and stayed in a two room suite with living area and pull out sofa and mini fridge/microwave area. HUGE bathroom :) Everything was immaculate and still had that new "smell". We were impressed with our stunning water views and a great continental breakfast that makes up for the $7.00 parking charge. We were able to check-in early and check-out late!!! That was a great bonus!!!
reviews.title: Luxury Stay at a Great Price

reviews.text: Great location in downtown Bremerton with restaurants and ferry all within walking distance. $8/day parking is a bit of a nuisance based on how dead the area is after hours. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Overall it was a good stay.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: This was our 4th time staying in a Fairfield properties in the last year or so. We were not disappointed. The consistant decor through out all these Fairfield properties provided us with confidence that they were clean and update. This one was no exception. The staff were very accommodating. The room we were in was large enough to put in two queen size bed so that the three of us could stay together without fighting for space. The room was clean and all amenities like toiletry items were provided. I used the 5-equipment fitness center. It was clean and the equipment were fairly new. The swimming pool was the usual small size config, with no sunna or Jacuzzi. The complimentary breakfast was good, with hot sausage, self-made waffle, fresh fruit, choice of yogurts, coffe and tea, cereal etc. The only downside was the parking fee. It was $7 per night, even though it was nothing, but I didn't expect a charge at all. The location of the hotel was really good. Walking distane to a few tourist attraction such as the USS Turner Joy Destroyer, Fountain Park, Naval Museum, and the ferry terminal to Seattle.
reviews.title: Live up to its name

reviews.text: Location could not have been better. A short walk to everything. We loved our king mattress and the shower was very big. The Wi-Fi was free, parking is $7/day. The Hot breakfast had plenty of options and was free. The staff was very friendly. We were very pleased!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: The few things I need in a hotel are cleanliness, comfortable bedding and quiet. This hotel does all of these very well. I never heard another guest, I slept really well and the place was very clean and well maintained during our entire stay. The breakfast was good, not great, but it was hot and well stocked as long as you didn't sleep in too late (see above quiet, comfortable rooms).
reviews.title: Nice hotel and great location

reviews.text: Location-wise, you are a short walk from the ferry which takes you right into downtown Seattle. You can leave your car parked in the hotel garage and enjoy the day (or evening at a baseball game) and not have to worry about driving in the traffic. There are some nice restaurants with short drives and even a few within walking distance. The Boat Shed across the Manette bridge was very nice, especially on the deck on a nice summer's eve. It is less than a mile from the Fairfield.
reviews.title: Definitely Recommend

reviews.text: I discovered the Fairfield Inn while driving to avoid ferry traffic.
reviews.title: Jumped the Hampton Ship for Fairfield and Couldn't Be Happier

reviews.text: The desk clerk had no problems showing me one of the rooms and I was a barely perceptible blur checking out of the Hampton, explaining apologetically to one of my favorite staff that I couldn't take the worn mattresses and beat-up furniture.
reviews.title: This is our second year there.

reviews.text: The Fairfield doesn't charge for parking (Hampton $7 per night) and parking is much more secure. The spaces are larger and you aren't fighting diners and sightseers and pedestrians for Concrete Supremacy.
reviews.title: Perfect location in downtown Bremerton

reviews.text: Exiting the hotel is much easier than at the Hampton since you're using a quieter side road.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location!

reviews.text: Rooms are great; more upscale than some Fairfields and the housekeeping was beyond reproach. The hotel has a much less chaotic feel than the Hampton because it doesn't share the location with restaurants and the ferry traffic but you're still close enough to walk to these without much fuss or fatigue.
reviews.title: Great Location and a Great Price

aka: Fairfield Inn And Suites Seattle Bremerton
description: Staying is believing with the staff of the Fairfield Inn and Suites Bremerton. Bremerton is home to Puget Sound Naval Base and the gateway to the Olympic Peninsula. Our hotel offers beautiful views of Sinclair Inlet and the Olympic Mountains. Bremerton is also home to the historic ship USS Turner Joy, as well as several local restaurants, galleries and shops. We are located a short walking distance from the Kitsap Conference Center, Puget Sound Naval Base and the Bremerton/Seattle ferry terminal. Like to Golf? Gold Mountain and Trophy Lake golf courses are a short drive away.
